intro: Acer tataricum subvar. torminaloides, commonly known as the Tatarian maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant yellow in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. Its small, aggregate fruits are produced in clusters, and the bark is smooth and grayish-brown. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
